title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas P. Jackson to Orlando Brown, December 31, 1867
summary: Jackson's report mentions an inflamatory comment allegedly made by a local magistrate, contrasts the sobriety of blacks around the Christmas holiday to "the brawling and drunkeness of the common white men," and describes efforts to procure aid for the poor.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Community Values/Local Behavior, Employment/Labor, Legal System, Race Relations, Violence/Crime, American Civil War
